[[size 75%]]This is a series showing off news from the site, articles from the past month[[footnote]] with a rating above 0 [[/footnote]], and fan-content for you to check out and discover! Be sure to leave a comment with your thoughts![[/size]]

++++* Fandom Stuff

* [[[halloween-contest-2018| Halloween Contest 2018]]] - The Bone Zone awakens! The 2018 Halloween contest kicks off October 5th, with 4 rules in place, all of them put in place for maximum spookiness. Readers beware, you're in for a scare.

* Staff Promotions! This cycle, there were a total of 6 new Operational Staff and 3 new Moderators! 
 * Junior Staff Promoted to Operational Staff: Captain Kirby, Fingo7, LadyKatie, Shaggydredlocks, taylor_itkin, and Varaxous!
 * Operational Staff promoted to Moderator: modern_erasmus, pxdnbluesoul, and MayD!

* On October 20th at 1 PM, [https://www.wasabicon.com/schedule/ Wasabicon] will be having an SCP panel!  roget and procyonlotor are going to be there helping out with the panel, while several other SCPeople are planning to make an appearance (including djkaktus and doctor cimmerian). Hope we can see ya there!

++++* Featured Articles

* The featured articles for this month were [[[SCP-1387]]] ("Giant Seagull Airlines") by Waterfire, [[[In the Clutches of Life]]] by Captain Kirby, and [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/schulman-ny-programmable-mnestic-device-ac34d-nc77q-95dcs 'Schulman-NY Programmable Mnestic Device' (AC34D/NC77Q/95DCS)] by WrongJohnSilver and Cyantreuse.
 * In [[[SCP-1387]]], a giant seagull decides to make its way into the airline industries.
 * [[[In the Clutches of Life]]]. And with strange aeons even death may die.
 * In [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/schulman-ny-programmable-mnestic-device-ac34d-nc77q-95dcs 'Schulman-NY Programmable Mnestic Device' (AC34D/NC77Q/95DCS)], we see just how much of your brain you really need to survive.


++++* Event Featured Articles

The theme for the month of September was //portal!//

* In [[[SCP-3941]]] ("The Major Occultation"), by tufto, the Foundation engages in religous debate with the 12th Imam.
* In [[[SCP-1780]]] ("The Temporal Anomalies Department"), by FortuneFavorsBold, a Foundation department is found, having been lost to all but time.
* In [[[SCP-1130]]] ("A Handy Shortcut"), by Crayne, your destination is on your left, through the derelict entrance into an alternate reality. 




++++* Editor's Choice

* [[[SCP-4344]]] ("Kick Asteroid") by Weryllium
> A woefully underrated article. It's short, it's got dinosaurs, and they're //in space!// What more could you ask for?

The OCT, or, [[[scp-oct-hub | Original Character Contest]]], was created by PeppersGhost to encourage some community fun. Every contestant entered with a character of their own creation to be paired against another contestant in a tale. Fighting, drinking, hanging out, nothing was off the table so long as it starred both parties equally. Though many entered, only one will win. The first two rounds have come and gone, so let's take a look at the matchups!

This contest has brought out all sorts of characters from different walks of life, meaning that different Groups/Persons of Interest appearing was inevitable. Let's take a look at which G/PoI's came out to play!

* from [[[dado-hub | dado's fine laundry and tan]]] is dado himself yes
* From [[[wilson-s-wildlife-solutions-hub | Wilson's Wildlife Solutions]]] hail [[[ringo | Ringo]]], [[[critter-profile-wobbles | Wobbles]]], and [[[critter-profile-maya | Maya]]], some of the wildest contestants yet!
* [[[critter-profile-wobbles | Wobbles]]], [[[ringo | Ringo]]], and [[[maya-the-magnificent | Maya the Magnificent]]] have ties to other GoI; The Shark Punching Center , [[[chaos-insurgency-hub | The Chaos Insurgency]]] and [[[herman-fuller-hub | Herman Fuller's Circus of the Disquieting]]] respectively. 
* [[[danger-in-the-manger | Heather Mason]]], otherwise known as 'Ms. Mad About Video Games' is a [[[gamers-against-weed-hub | GAW]]] affiliated anomaly. 
* [[[SCP-4799 | Shock]]] has indirect ties to the [[[goc-hub-page | Global Occult Coalition.]]]

Since we're looking at the backgrounds of some characters, why not take a look and see what kind of article they came from as well?

* [[[the-summer-of-bad-memories | Ruslav Diaghilev]]], [[[slice-of-life | Tyrone]]], and [[[ethics | Agent Johnson]]] come from Tales. 
* [[[ringo | Ringo]]], [[[critter-profile-wobbles | Wobbles]]], and [[[critter-profile-maya | Maya]]] all originated from GoI Format articles, with the lattermost even having a [[[maya-the-magnificent | double feature premiere!]]]
* [[[scp-wow-j | Dr. Fynegan]]] is the only contestant originating from a Joke article. 
* All other contestants originated from a main-list SCP article.

Assorted fun facts
* [[[a-romantic-comedy-starring-a-dead-mosquito-guest-starring-th| Let Her Heart DEET Once More]]] - by OthellotheCat was the first OCT entry posted in the contest.
* [[[the-antihero-by-dado| the antihero by dado]]] - by djkaktus was the last Round 1 OCT article posted.
* Four entries used custom CSS themes, including [[[a-bearly-thought-out-plan| A Bear-ly Thought Out Plan]]] which uses the WWS Theme, [[[the-abyss-gazes-back| The Abyss Gazes Back (And It's ASCII On A CRT Screen)]]] uses the Pataphysics Theme, and [[[tyrone-joins-the-family| Tyrone Joins the Family]]] and [[[cater-duty| Cater Duty]]] both use the Spicy Crust Pizza theme.
* Nine contestants (Maya, Gunhead Anomalocaris, Wobbles, Ringo, poky, Leslie, Tree Critter, Robber Ducks, Buddy, and Anoati) are non-humanoids. 
* Two entrants (Robber Ducks and poky) are more than one character, with poky bringing The Great Carnegias along for the ride, and Robber Ducks consisting of five separate entities. 
* The Plague Doctor is the oldest contestant in the OCT, with SCP-049 being posted on the 10th of December 2009.
* In contrast; The Great Anoati is the youngest entrant, with SCP-3416 having been posted on the 24th of August 2018.
* newyrose made custom Snapchat CSS for use in [[[grin-and-bear-it| Grin and Bear It]]] and [[[a-bearly-thought-out-plan| A Bear-ly Thought Out Plan.]]] She did an excellent job! 
* [[[prehistoric-artillery-strike| Derailment By Prehistoric Artillery Strike]]] and [[[trilobastards| Trilobites: Many Reasons To Kill Them, and 0 Reasons Not To]]] are both tagged with 'interactive', meaning there's listpages magic afoot!
* [[[grin-and-bear-it| Grin and Bear It]]] and [[[a-bearly-thought-out-plan| A Bear-ly Thought Out Plan]]] tell a continuous story, and are the only Round 1 tales with a chronological order between contestants. 
* There were not one, but two ties in the contest, meaning there will be two three-way character meetings next round, not counting the Bonus Round contestants. 
* Nine Round 1 tale titles are puns. We'll let you figure out which ones they are. 
* Two Round 2 tales are song title references. 
* othellothecat was the first entrant to post their entry in Round 2. Fast fingers on this one!
* othellothecat and gabriel jade tied again, this time the great hippo tied as well leading to the first three-way tie of the contest!
